result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert D. Calkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert D. Calkins is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert D. Calkins was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and court costs are to be paid at $50 per month commencing 7-15-15 and on the 15th of each month thereafter until paid in full.  Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  Bond will be returned to the poster.
Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.

records.addlTxt: Destroyed fingerprint card and gave note to Jan to refund cash bond.

Defendant appeared with counsel SPD Carly Sebion.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  State has complied with victim notification - no appearance by victim.  Have an agreement with a joint recommendation.  Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1.  Court reviews elements/PLQ/WOR.  Finds he understands the proceedings and freely, voluntarily and intelligently enters his plea and waives his rights freely and voluntarily; factual basis exists.  Count 2 is dismissed.  Joint recommendation for a fine of $50 plus costs including DNA surcharge.  Defense requests the cash bond be returned to the poster and defendant be granted a payment plan.  Court finds guilty of Count 1 and adopts the recommendation.  $50 plus costs including the DNA surcharge and Domestic Abuse surcharge = $616.00 total.  May pay at $50 per month commencing 7-15-15. Failure to pay in full by the due date will result in serving 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  Court ordered bond returned to the poster.  Credit for 4 days jail.  Defendant to keep Clerk of Court aware of his mailing address if he were to move.
ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant through Attorney Sebion.  Can set for plea/sentencing.  Court set for 6/15/15 at  1:30 pm

Pre-trial conference at 04-22-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 05-11-2015 03:00 pm.

ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person with Attorney Sebion.  Reading of complaint waived, and defendant stood mute to the charges.  Court entered NGP on defendant's behalf.  PTC & STC set.  Bond continued.

ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared without counsel.  Court advised defendant of charges and possible penalties.  Defendant understood.  He is trying to qualify for SPD.  Court explains options.  Bond continued.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: Deanna S.

DA Fox appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail, without counsel.  Court advised defendant of the charges and possible penalties.  Defendant understood.  Court advised defendant to contact SPD.  DA Fox requested $1,000 cash bond.  Ordered with the condition that defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals:  Deanna S.  AIA Set for 3/16/15.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: Deanna S.
